node.title: Whale carcass off Rottnest Island sparks shark feeding frenzy
node.description: A huge whale carcass floating just off Perth's holiday playground of Rottnest Island attracts a large group of sharks, prompting authorities to close the island's beaches.
node.content:
["Several large sharks have spent the morning feasting on a decomposing whale carcass off Rottnest Island\u00a0near Perth in WA.", "The feeding frenzy had been taking place about 100 metres offshore from the holiday destination, near the Thomson Bay ferry jetty.", "Dozens of people gathered on the jetty to watch the spectacle.", "The whale\u00a0was already missing huge chunks from various bites.", "Some sharks could be seen rising out of the water and thrashing about as they tore flesh from the huge mammal.", "Its species has not yet been confirmed.", "
Whale carcass towed away from shore
", "As part of an operation to remove the whale, Department of\u00a0Fisheries officers tied a rope around its tail to tow\u00a0it further from the beach.", "All the while the sharks followed, continuing to feed on the dead creature.", "", "
Fisheries officers are tagging some of the sharks that have been feeding on the whale.(ABC News)
", "The whale is set to be towed about 3 kilometres west of Rottnest,\u00a0where it can catch the Leeuwin Current and be carried south, further away from populated beaches.", "Rottnest Island rangers have closed the island's most popular swimming spots at Thomson Bay, Pinky Beach, the Basin\u00a0and Longreach Bay.", "It is not uncommon for whale carcasses off WA beaches to attract sharks, but it is not often the spectacle can be so clearly seen.", "Ferry services to Rottnest\u00a0have not been interrupted but skippers have been asked to take care to avoid the whale.", "A Department of Fisheries spokesman said they were also taking advantage of the opportunity to conduct tagging of some of the sharks in the vicinity of the carcass."]
